metadata.title: CVE-2016-7426 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
NTP before 4.2.8p9 rate limits responses received from the configuredsources when rate limiting for all associations is enabled, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (prevent responses from thesources) by sending responses with a spoofed source address.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7426` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.11
ntpdate - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.11').
